lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
* The Deadline class represents a task with a specific deadline.
* It extends the Task class and provides methods to mark and unmark the task as done.
* Constructs a Deadline instance with the specified task description and deadline.
* @param task The description of the task.
* @param deadline The deadline for the task.
System.out.println(super.line() + "Okay, I have marked this task as completed!" + "\n" + this.toString());
System.out.println(super.line() + "Okay, I have marked this task as incomplete!" + "\n" + this.toString());

* This control represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to represent the speaker's face and a label
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {

* The Duke class represents a task management application that allows users to interact with tasks.
* It provides methods to manage tasks, mark them as done, and perform various operations on tasks.
* Constructs a Duke instance with the specified file path to load task data from.
* The Event class represents a task with a specific start and end time.
* It extends the Task class and provides methods to mark and unmark the task as done.
* Constructs a Event instance with the specified task description, start time, and end time.
* @param task The description of the task.
* @param start The start time for the event.
* @param end The end time for the event.
public Event(String task, LocalDate start, LocalDate end) {
System.out.println(super.line() + "Okay, I have marked this task as completed!" + "\n" + this.toString());
System.out.println(super.line() + "Okay, I have marked this task as incomplete!" + "\n" + this.toString());
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input and determining the corresponding actions to take.
* It provides methods to read user input, check for specific command types, and manage the input scanner.
private static final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Retrieves the user input from the scanner.
* @return The user input as a string.
* Sets the user input to a new value.
* @param newUserInput The new user input value to set.
* Checks if the user wants to exit the application.
* @return True if the user input is "bye", indicating an exit command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to list tasks.
* @return True if the user input is "list", indicating a list command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to mark a task as done.
* @return True if the user input starts with "mark ", indicating a mark command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to unmark a task as done.
* @return True if the user input starts with "unmark ", indicating an unmark command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to delete a task.
* @return True if the user input starts with "delete ", indicating a delete command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to add a todo task.
* @return True if the user input starts with "todo ", indicating a todo command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to add a deadline task.
* @return True if the user input starts with "deadline ", indicating a deadline command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to add an event task.
* @return True if the user input starts with "event ", indicating an event command; false otherwise.
* Checks if the user wants to find a specific task.
* @return True if the user input starts with "find ", indicating an event command; false otherwise.
* Closes the scanner used for reading user input.
* The Storage class represents a storage system for task data.
* It provides methods to handle loading and saving task data to/from a file.
* Constructs a Storage instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file used for storing task data.
* Loads task data from the file.
* @return The file containing the task data.
* The Task class represents a generic task item with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a Task instance with the specified task description.
* @param task The description of the task.
* Checks if the task is marked as done.
* @return True if the task is marked as done, false otherwise.
* Returns a horizontal line used for separating sections.
* @return The horizontal line as a string.
* Returns a formatted string representation of the task.
* @return The formatted string representation of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task with checkbox status.
* @return The string representation of the task.

private static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();

throw new DukeException("Error: Task is already marked as incomplete!");
String response = Ui.line + "You've marked the following task as incomplete:"

* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
return line + "Until we meet once more in the near future, I bid you farewell." + "\n" + line;
